com.almundo.callcenter.beans

Class Call

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almundo.callcenter.beans.Call
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Call
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Call class implements the Runnable interface and the Thread is created by the ThreadPoolExecutor class. This Call class has all the behavior of a call. It is also responsible for calling the dispatchCall method, so that the Dispatch can assign an employee of the callCenter and attend said call
    Since:
    23/03/2019
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marcelo Daniel Martini

      • getCallStatus

        public CallStatus getCallStatus()
        Gets the call status. returns the state of the call that can be:      * The not started.      * NOT_STARTED,     * The waiting.     * WAITING,      * The active.      * ACTIVE,      * The disconnected.      * DISCONNECTED;
        Returns:
        callStatus CallStatus

      • setCallStatus

        Parameters:

      • run

        public void run()
        This run method is executed when the call is generated, that is, when the customer dials the call center from their telephone. This thread will start with the start method and then the run method will be called, in this way the call runs like a thread The call to the callcenter was initiated by the client, this means that he marked the number of the call center and pressed the button of his telephone call
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
